reviewText: A lot of real talent was wasted in the making of this disaster.  So many fine actors and well known faces it is a real shame it did not come off better.  A great actor can only do so much when handed a piece of trash to work with.  This script was lifeless, the direction uninspired, the music completely obnoxious and the filming stiff.  I can live with a totally predictable plot (what Bonanza episode wasn't)if it is done with intelligence and style, but a bad plot is a bad plot and this one is worse.  Preachy, unrealistic and forced.  What a sad thing!
summary: How to screw up a great franchise.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I missed the 3 Bonanza TV movies when they were first broadcast so I'm glad two of them are available on DVD. I enjoyed the Next Generation and Under Attack and Amazon has them at excellent prices. Both movies are good fun and I'm happy to have them in my Western DVD collection. Now they just need to release Bonanza: The Return on DVD too.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Horrible story, bad casting (with only a few exceptions), and what's with the overly loud, saccharine background music???? I felt sorry for the actors though they may have had little idea while filming what a disaster this would be. I bought it because I was looking for Robert Fuller performances and no one on Amazon had written a bad review. This is a bad, bad, bad, bad film.
summary: I couldn't watch all of it

reviewText: Great to see old actors from previous series and remember the missing cart-wrights which made bonanza possible. Worth watching to see some good old western fun.
summary: Bonanza remembers and finds a way for its land

reviewText: As all of the Bonanza show these movies were great. I really enjoyed it and I love the idea that Adam, Hoss and Little Joe got to have children. And have the image of Ben being a grandpa. Than you so much Amazon.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am a huge fan of Robert Fuller's and have tried to snatch up anything I could find with him in any kind of role, especially westerns.  Bob just don't seem right (to me) without a horse and a gun in hand, and in this DVD, we have both.  AND some very old kool cars!  I wasn't sure what to expect from this movie.  I did watch Bonanza but was not a huge fan.  Laramie and Wagon Train were amongst my favorites.  The title of this DVD made me think it was going to be a poor remake of the old series, but was pleasantly surprised at how terrific the movie really was.  The premise of the changing environment between the old and new west contrasting each other was fabulous.  Bob, as usual he was a shining star and perfect to play the character of Charlie Poke.  I must say, I have already watched it twice and know it will be amongst one of my favorite movies.  MORE, PLEASE?
Title: N/A

reviewText: I will admit I got this movie because I loved Bonanza and Robert Fuller is in it. It is a very standard TV movie that is particularly wholesome. It doesn't even have the level of grittiness that the original show had.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I just remembered as I watched the movie that Michael Landon and Pernell Roberts were alive and didn't participate. Dan Blocker's real son could have played his fictional son, but wasn't chosen.  Lorne Greene was set to participate, but died suddenly.  David Canary and others possibly weren't asked to participate ... So the movie was nice, but could have been so much better.  Then to add insult to injury, a few years later, the same movie was remade for NBC with different actors. Which really and truly put a bad taste in my mouth.  Yet and still, this syndicated trip to the Ponderosa makes for great Sunday afternoon viewing.
Title: N/A
